instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no chime ( I have a lot of these :/ )
threads.message:
Hi I’ve done these checks audio is working removed ram and it beeped once

I have
<SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU_PH1</SIGNAL> =.950
<SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU_PH2</SIGNAL> =.774v
<SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU_PH3</SIGNAL> =.774v
but still no chime 

I checked
At <CHIP>U2880</CHIP> 
<SIGNAL>PLT_RST_BUF_L</SIGNAL> = 3.3v
At <CHIP>U2890</CHIP>
<SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> =3.3v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no chime ( I have a lot of these :/ )
threads.message:
The 3 CPU phase are tied together.
I suppose you've checked phase 1 faster than other two.
Board starts with higher VCORE, which drops a bit once board boots.

Did you try PRAM reset?
Also check USB activity.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no chime ( I have a lot of these :/ )
threads.message: im sorry yes i habe usb mouse flash red. and theres a blue light on my microsoft mouse. Cpu and gpu are getting warm. The last time I had this same issue it was a <SIGNAL>RESET_L</SIGNAL> signal missing but they’re both present :/

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no chime ( I have a lot of these :/ )
threads.message:
I will put in a case and try a PRAM reset 
Thank you

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no chime ( I have a lot of these :/ )
threads.message: I tried a PRAM reset and nothing it still won’t chime but both cpu/gpu are getting warm. I’m gonna go over the audio circuit again

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no chime ( I have a lot of these :/ )
threads.message:
Do not use chime as a "must" for life sign.
If you are sure about USB activity, check external video, before arming up the machine.
When the board really boots, you should also note a slow drop on CPU VCORE; from initially 1.15V to 0.8V aprox...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no chime ( I have a lot of these :/ )
threads.message: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> = dead GPU
